title: Pep Guardiola pays ultimate compliment to Barcelona and Hansi Flick after Inter draw
body_text:
Former Barcelona boss Pep Guardiola has shared his thoughts on Wednesday’s Champions League draw with Inter.
Pep Guardiola pays ultimate compliment to Barcelona and Hansi Flick after Inter draw
He’s feeling proud
The City manager admitted he loved watching the thrilling game and says the way Barcelona are playing football will ensure fans are desperate to see them in action.
‘I was surprised how nice was the game,” he told a press conference. “So thanks to these types of games the stadiums will never, ever be empty, and our business will grow up.
‘So I can just be grateful for the two semi-finals because both were unbelievable, especially yesterday’s game.
“When you play like Barcelona play, the stadiums will never, ever be empty and we can live in that business for a long, long time. So it doesn’t matter the result, how proud the people who love Barcelona are.”
Guardiola also had some praise for Inter and Simone Inzaghi and is looking forward to next week’s return game.
“And I think Inter prove again when we won the Champions League against the opponent we played, it’s incredible Inter how good they defend in transitions, physicality, well organised. Inzaghi is an unbelievable manager,” he added.
“Next Tuesday and Wednesday will be incredible, the two games. I think they’re four fantastic teams and they deserve to be there.”
The winners of the tie will play either PSG or Arsenal in the final in Munich. PSG lead 1-0 from the first leg, thanks to Ousmane Dembele’s goal.
